title: P06-3007

sentences.text: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches .
In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements .
With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events .
With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents .

Entity-relevant_approach.label: relevant approach
Entity-relevant_approach.description: The 'relevant approach' refers to a method in event-based extractive multi-document summarization that utilizes the PageRank algorithm to identify important content based on an event map constructed from the documents.

Entity-independent_approach.label: independent approach
Entity-independent_approach.description: The 'independent approach' refers to a method in event-based extractive multi-document summarization that identifies important content based on the frequency of event terms.

Entity-approach.label: approaches
aliases: independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches
Entity-approach.description: The term 'approaches' refers to the independent and relevant methodologies used for event-based extractive multi-document summarization, which involve identifying important content through frequency analysis and PageRank algorithms.

mentions.local_name: independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches

Entity-event_map.label: event map
Entity-event_map.description: The 'event map' refers to a data structure that organizes and represents events and their associated elements extracted from multiple documents, which is utilized in the context of event-based extractive summarization to identify important content using a PageRank algorithm.

Entity-event.label: events
Entity-event.description: In this paper, 'events' refers to defined event terms and their associated elements used in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-important_content.label: important contents
Entity-important_content.description: The term 'important contents' refers to the significant data or information extracted from documents based on the frequency of identified event terms in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-event_element.label: event elements
Entity-event_element.description: Event elements refer to the components or attributes associated with events that are utilized in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-associated_event_element.label: associated event elements
Entity-associated_event_element.description: Associated event elements refer to the components or attributes that are linked to specific events in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-frequency_of_event.label: frequency of events
Entity-frequency_of_event.description: The 'frequency of events' refers to a statistical measure used in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization to identify important content by quantifying how often specific events occur within the analyzed documents.

Entity-document.label: documents
Entity-document.description: The term 'documents' refers to the textual data sources utilized in the study for constructing an event map to facilitate event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-encouraging.label: encouraging
Entity-encouraging.description: The term 'encouraging' refers to the positive outcomes observed in the experimental results of the event-based extractive multi-document summarization approaches discussed in the paper.

Entity-pagerank_algorithm.label: PageRank algorithm
Entity-pagerank_algorithm.description: The PageRank algorithm is a mathematical method used to rank web pages in search engine results based on their importance and relevance, utilizing the structure of links between pages.

Entity-experimental_result.label: Experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the data and observations obtained from conducting scientific experiments, which are used to evaluate hypotheses and draw conclusions.

summary: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches . In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements . With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events . With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents . Experimental results are encouraging .

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: The predicate 'investigate' denotes the action of examining, exploring, or inquiring into a subject or object in order to uncover information, understand its nature, or determine its characteristics. In the context of the triple, it connects the subject and object by indicating that the subject is actively engaging in the process of investigation regarding the object, thereby establishing a relationship of inquiry and discovery.

Predicate-are_defined_as.label: are defined as
Predicate-are_defined_as.description: The predicate 'are defined as' establishes a relationship of equivalence or specification between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is characterized or identified by the object. It suggests that the object provides a definition, classification, or description that encapsulates the essence or nature of the subject.

Predicate-associated_with.label: associated with
Predicate-associated_with.description: The predicate 'associated with' indicates a relationship of connection or relevance between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject has a link, correlation, or partnership with the object in a broader context. This relationship can imply that the subject and object share common characteristics, functions, or contexts, and that understanding one may provide insights into the other.

Predicate-identify.label: identify
Predicate-identify.description: The predicate 'identify' establishes a relationship where the subject recognizes, determines, or establishes the existence or nature of the object. It implies a process of discernment or classification, where the subject actively engages in the act of pinpointing or naming the object, often highlighting its significance or characteristics.

Predicate-by_frequency_of.label: by frequency of
Predicate-by_frequency_of.description: The predicate 'by frequency of' establishes a relationship that quantifies or categorizes the subject based on the occurrence or prevalence of the object. It indicates that the subject is assessed, analyzed, or defined in relation to how often the object appears or is present, suggesting a comparative or statistical evaluation.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject derives its principles, conclusions, or characteristics from the object. It suggests that the subject is influenced by, or constructed upon, the information, data, or concepts represented by the object.

Predicate-identifies.label: identifies
Predicate-identifies.description: The predicate 'identifies' denotes an action where the subject recognizes, determines, or establishes the existence or significance of the object. It implies a process of discernment or classification, where the subject is actively engaging in the act of pinpointing or naming the object, which is often a concept, item, or set of information that holds relevance or importance in a given context.

Predicate-is_applied_on.label: is applied on
Predicate-is_applied_on.description: The predicate 'is applied on' indicates a relationship where the subject, typically a method, technique, or algorithm, is utilized or executed in relation to the object, which represents a specific dataset, system, or context. This implies that the subject is being used to analyze, process, or derive insights from the object.

Predicate-constructed_from.label: constructed from
Predicate-constructed_from.description: The predicate 'constructed from' indicates that the subject is formed or created using the materials, components, or elements represented by the object. It implies a relationship where the object serves as the foundational or essential basis for the existence or structure of the subject.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' serves as a linking verb that connects the subject to a complement, indicating a state of being or existence. It establishes an identity or relationship between the subject and the object, often describing characteristics, qualities, or conditions of the subject.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or concept that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a larger set of characteristics or instances that include the subject, thereby providing a context in which the subject can be understood as part of a broader classification.
